column4: guys, if i want a bash saved in a file, what extension should i use?
GNU/Linux doesn't care about file extensions. But you could use .sh if you really needed one
for folder? what is it called?
no, press alt+tab on your keyboard
I does different things. Maybe my key bindings configured different from your :D
ssv1994 : unless you edit the names :)
little by little dude. That's what I do ;)
open nautilus and drag a folder to the Places pane
